name: Engineering Physics Lab
references: Physics Laboratory Manual, School of Sciences (Physics), National Institute of Technology Andhra Pradesh (2020).
Practical Physics (Electricity, Magnetism, and Electronics), R. K. Shukla, A Srivastava, New age international publishers (2011).
B.Sc. Practical Physics, C. L. Arora, S. Chand & Co. Ltd. (2012).
experiments: Determination of Planck’s constant using light emitting diode.
Determination of wavelength of monochromatic light in Newton’s ring experiment.
Determination of the width of narrow slit by diffraction method.
Determination of wavelength of He-Ne laser using diffraction by a metal scale.
Determination of capacitance and time constant of a capacitor using R-C circuit.
Determination of wavelength of mercury spectrum by normal incidence method (diffraction grating).
Determination of specific rotation of an optically active material-using Laurent’s half-shade polarimeter
Determination of resonating frequency and bandwidth of an LCR circuit.
Determination of dielectric constant of various dielectric materials.
Studying B-H curve loop and permeability of magnetic materials.
Measuring spatial distribution of magnetic field between a pair of identical coils using Helmholtz coils.
Studying current-voltage characteristics of a photovoltaic material using solar cell.
Determination of numerical aperture of an optical fibre.
Determination of resistivities of various materials using four-probe method
